org.sakaiproject.message.api

Interface MessageHeaderEdit

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AttachmentContainer, AttachmentContainerEdit, MessageHeader
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AnnouncementMessageHeaderEdit, MailArchiveMessageHeaderEdit
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseAnnouncementService.BaseAnnouncementMessageHeaderEdit, BaseMailArchiveService.BaseMailArchiveMessageHeaderEdit, BaseMessageService.BaseMessageHeaderEdit

    public interface MessageHeaderEdit
extends MessageHeader, AttachmentContainerEdit

    MessageHeader is the base Interface for a Sakai Message headers. Header fields common to all message service message headers are defined here.

    Author:
    Sakai Software Development Team

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.sakaiproject.message.api.MessageHeader

        MessageHeader.MessageAccess

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearGroupAccess()
      Remove any grouping for this message; the access mode reverts to channel and any groups are removed.

      Set the date/time the message was sent to the channel.

      Set the User who sent the message to the channel.

        void setDate(Time date)
        Set the date/time the message was sent to the channel.

      • setMessage_order

        Set the message order the message was sent to the channel.

        message - order The message order the message was sent to the channel.

        Set the User who sent the message to the channel.
        Parameters:

      • setDraft

        void setDraft(boolean draft)
        Set the draft status of the message.
        Parameters:
        draft - True if the message is a draft, false if not.

      • setGroupAccess

        void setGroupAccess(Collection groups)
                    throws PermissionException
        Set these as the message's groups, replacing the access and groups already defined.
        Parameters:
        Collection - groups The colelction of Group objects to use for this message.
        Throws:
        PermissionException - if the end user does not have permission to remove from the groups that would be removed or add to the groups that would be added.

      • clearGroupAccess

        void clearGroupAccess()
                      throws PermissionException
        Remove any grouping for this message; the access mode reverts to channel and any groups are removed.
        Throws:
        PermissionException - if the end user does not have permission to do this.
